subject: Investing
title: Barbell Strategy
description: A fast breakdown of Barbell Strategy for builders.

hook.text: Hold very short-term and very long-term bonds. Skip the middle entirely. It sounds reckless. It actually works.

buildup.text: Short bonds give you flexibility and low risk. Long bonds give you higher yield. The barbell captures both.

discovery.text: Nassim Taleb popularized the idea: keep most money safe and a small portion in high-risk, high-reward positions.

twist.text: The barbell struggles when the yield curve is flat. If middle maturities pay the same, extremes add nothing.

climax.text: When rates are volatile, the barbell shines. Short bonds adapt fast while long bonds capture any yield premium.

punchline.text: The barbell strategy bets on extremes. Sometimes the middle is no man's land.

quiz.question: What does a barbell bond strategy involve?
options: Holding short-term and long-term bonds, skipping the middle
